    • Neo4j Bolt Driver 1.6 for R

Neo4j Bolt Driver 1.6 for R

Brett Taylor

2018-07-16

Source: vignettes/Neo4j_Driver.Rmd
Neo4j_Driver.Rmd

Quick Example

from neo4j.v1 import GraphDatabase
import os
uri = os.environ['NEO4J_URI']
pswd = os.environ['NEO4J_PSWD']
uid = os.environ['NEO4J_USER']
driver = GraphDatabase.driver(uri, auth=(uid, pswd))
#> /home/travis/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neo4j/v1/security.py:127: UserWarning: Bolt over TLS is only available in Python 2.7.9+ and Python 3.3+ so communications are not secure
#>   warn("Bolt over TLS is only available in Python 2.7.9+ and Python 3.3+ "
def print_friends_of(tx, name):
    for record in tx.run("MATCH (a:Person)-[:KNOWS]->(f) "
                         "WHERE a.name = {name} "
                         "RETURN f.name", name=name):
      print(record["f.name"])
with driver.session() as session:
    session.read_transaction(print_friends_of, "Alice")

Convert this to R

library(Neo4jDriveR)
uri = "bolt://172.20.0.1:7687"
driver = GraphDatabase$driver(uri, auth=c("neo4j", "neo4j_is_nice"))
print_friends_of <- function(tx, name){
  records <- tx$run("MATCH (a:Person)-[:KNOWS]->(f)
                    WHERE a.name = {name}
                    RETURN f.name", name=name)
  
}

session <- driver.session()
session$read_transaction(print_friends_of, "Alice")

Next Generation of R - To make it useable by a data scientist

library(Neo4jDriveR)

uri = "bolt://172.20.0.1:7687"
driver <- graph_driver(uri, user_id = "neo4j", password = "neo4j_is_nice")
print_friends_of <- function(tx, name){
  records <- graph_run(tx, "MATCH (a:Person)-[:KNOWS]->(f)
                    WHERE a.name = {name}
                    RETURN f.name", name=name)
  records
  
}

session <- graph_session(driver)
results <- graph_read_transaction(session, print_friends_of, "Alice")
print(results)

Installation

API Documentation

To install the latest stable version, use:

install.packages("Neo4jDriveR")
